content:
I am a second-year master’s student in the Systems, Control and Mechatronics program at the Chalmers University of Technology, Sweden. During my first-year, I was a part of the Chalmers Formula Student Driverless (CFSD) team, a student-driven project team building a high-performance autonomous racecar. During my time at CFSD20, I was responsible for Vision, Localization and Embedded Software.
Before Chalmers, I worked at Robert Bosch GmbH as a Senior Software Engineer, where I developed device drivers for safety-critical supply modules in all Bosch electrical braking system products. My reasearch interests include distributed Deep Learning, Autonomous Decision Making, Computer Vision, Robotics and Sensor Fusion.
summary: I am a second-year master’s student in the Systems, Control and Mechatronics program at the Chalmers University of Technology, Sweden. During my first-year, I was a part of the Chalmers Formula Student Driverless (CFSD) team, a student-driven project team building a high-performance autonomous racecar.
title: Sourab Bapu Sridhar

Understanding Different Types Of Machine Learning Problems

content:
With more and more devices being connected to the internet, Artificial Intelligence (AI) is becoming the driving technology of the 21st century, just as microcontrollers were the driving technology of the 20th century. According to x, the investments in AI startups have quadrupled in the past y years, topping as high as z Billion USD. Although AI is the core enabler of self-driving cars, digital assistants, medical imaging for many other important technologies, the correct understanding of this important technology seems scarce. Additionally, due to the large hype around this technology, there seem to be many misunderstandings between the terminology. This can be particularly observed when people switch the terms Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning around all the time. Although the terms seem to be equivalent, the meaning of each term is slightly different in reality. Therefore, the goal of this post is to understand the difference between Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and Deep Learning (DL).
Artificial Intelligence Artificial Narrow Intelligence Artificial General Intelligence Artificial Super Intelligence Machine Learning Supervised Learning Unsupervised Learning Reinforcement Learning Semi-Supervised Learning Deep Learning Summary
summary: With more and more devices being connected to the internet, Artificial Intelligence (AI) is becoming the driving technology of the 21st century, just as microcontrollers were the driving technology of the 20th century.
title: Understanding the difference between Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and Deep Learning (DL)
